sentence.Network_en: A barge was about a hundred yards away, waiting to return seaward.
sentence.Network_cn: 一艘驳船停在大约100码开外，等待着返海回航。

sentence.Network_en: the seaward side of the coastal road
The houses on the seaward side of the road were all in ruins.
sentence.Network_cn: 马路临海一侧的房子全部沦为废墟。

entry.def: Something that moves or faces seaward or seawards moves or faces in the direction of the sea or further out to sea.

example.ex: A barge was about a hundred yards away, waiting to return seaward...
example.tran: 一艘驳船停在大约 100 码开外，等待着返海回航。

example.ex: It faced seawards to the north.

entry.def: The seaward side of something faces in the direction of the sea or further out to sea.

example.ex: The houses on the seaward side of the road were all in ruins.
example.tran: 马路临海一侧的房子全部沦为废墟。

means.word_mean: 1. (of winds) coming from the sea toward the land;
2. directed or situated away from inland regions and toward the sea or coast;

sentences.sentence: "from the hill he took a seaward course"
"on the seaward side of the road"

means.word_mean: 1. in the direction of the sea;

auth_sentence.content: The rest of the story is an account of the fabulous cities that the ship's company visits on its journey seaward.
